principles.name: The Unexpected Call as Ultimate Validation
principles.description: What would be most missed in retirement is 'the unexpected phone call' - calls about deeply personal business decisions like divorce from business partners or firing someone for the first time.

principles.name: Guidance Over Direction
principles.description: The value provided is 'not to tell them what to do, but to give them guidance so that they feel better and a little bit more confident about whatever it is, whatever that next step is.'

principles.name: Trusted Advisor for Life-Changing Moments
principles.description: Being the person someone calls for guidance on major life transitions - from business partnership divorces to first-time firings - represents the deepest level of professional trust and reliance.

patterns.name: Crisis Confidence Building
patterns.description: Provide guidance during high-stakes personal and business decisions that helps people 'feel better and a little bit more confident' rather than dictating specific actions.
patterns.context: Major business or personal transitions where decision-makers need emotional support and confidence-building rather than directive advice.

examples.name: Unexpected Call Examples
examples.content: Dan describes receiving unexpected calls from business owners about deeply personal decisions: 'getting a divorce. About their business partner' and decisions about 'finally fire their first person.' These calls represent moments when people rely on him for guidance to feel 'better and a little bit more confident about whatever that next step is.'

examples.name: What Would Be Most Missed
examples.content: When asked what he would miss most if he retired, Dan immediately responds 'The unexpected phone call' - indicating that spontaneous moments of being needed for major life and business decisions represent the core value and satisfaction of his work.
